meanings.definition: The process of water vapor in the air turning into liquid water.
meanings.sent1: During the hike, we saw condensation forming on the windows of the cabin.
meanings.sent2: The morning dew on the grass is a result of condensation overnight.
meanings.sent3: The condensation on the mirror made it hard to see our reflections clearly.
meanings.sent4: Her glasses fogged up due to the condensation from the hot soup.
meanings.sent5: The condensation on the cold drink made the glass slippery to hold.

meanings.definition: The act of making something more concentrated or dense.
meanings.sent1: The condensation of flavors in the stew made it taste richer.
meanings.sent2: The condensation of people in the small room made it feel crowded.
meanings.sent3: The condensation of ideas in his mind led to a breakthrough.
meanings.sent4: The condensation of traffic on the highway caused delays.
meanings.sent5: The condensation of dust on the shelves made them look dirty.

meanings.definition: The result of a gas or vapor turning into a liquid.
meanings.sent1: The condensation on the cold soda can showed how cold it was.
meanings.sent2: The condensation on the bathroom mirror was caused by the hot shower.
meanings.sent3: The condensation on the car windows made funny shapes.
meanings.sent4: The condensation on the grass in the morning made it wet.
meanings.sent5: The condensation on the metal pipe dripped slowly to the ground.
